definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: "Other patriots" refers primarily to the enlightened gentry.
sentences.chinese: 所说的“其他爱国人士”，则主要地是指的开明绅士。

sentences.english: He liked to think of himself as a liberal.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢把自己想象成开明人士。

sentences.english: We discovered an openness to new ideas is essential.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现，对新思想的开明态度至关重要。

sentences.english: Adenauer's relevant political actions helped the European Integration to develop further.
sentences.chinese: 阿登纳的开明政治行动推动了欧洲联合的发展。

sentences.english: In liberal education punishment no longer exists. Teachers and students are just like friends.
sentences.chinese: 开明教育也将惩戒体罚拒之门外，倡导师生如友。

sentences.english: Catherine the Great thought she governed in an enlightened manner.
sentences.chinese: 叶卡捷琳娜大帝认为她在实行开明统治。

sentences.english: But for the enlightened few, the benefits are  bountiful.
sentences.chinese: 但对于少数开明的老板来说，则收益颇多。

sentences.english: It’s an indication that you are open-minded and never want to stop learning.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它表明你虚心开明，永远也不会停止学习。

sentences.english: Keep an open mind to new ideas and information.
sentences.chinese: 对新创意和信息保持开明的态度。

sentences.english: It was not a liberal government that Micah founded.
sentences.chinese: 弥迦建立的政府并非开明。

sentences.english: At last, the paper analyzed educational thought of editors in KaiMing Bookstore, and discussed their educational practice.
sentences.chinese: 最后分析开明书店编辑教育理念及教育实践的情况。

sentences.english: But now, they are more open-minded.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在，他们的思想更加开明。

sentences.english: Not knowing what’s right allows you to stay open-minded and flexible.
sentences.chinese: 不知道什么是正确的让你保持思想开明，思维灵活。

sentences.english: She Kai Ming(60) and his grandchildren sitting in front of their destroied house.
sentences.chinese: 佘开明和他的孙子孙女坐在自家废墟前面。

sentences.english: The enlightened man highlighted his mighty insight into the fright.
sentences.chinese: 开明的人强调了他对惊悸的强大洞察力。

definition: fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
to value males and attach less importance to females (idiom)
